alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; Morrison (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 2:46AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. For the Mississippi River...including Mississippi at Grand Rapids, Prairie River near Taconite, Aitkin, Mississippi R at Brainerd, Fort Ripley, Snake at Pine City, Danbury...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fort Ripley. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, This will cause minor flooding of rural areas near Fort Ripley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning and continue rising to a crest of 11.5 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 04/05/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CDT.
